translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter with Timira
The Elder Timirapupphiya’s Story
On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I was swimming in the current.
Seeing a monk sitting there,🔽clear and unclouded,
I had faith in him right there,
and I thought this at that time:
“He will save those who are not saved,
he will tame those who are not tamed.
He will give relief to those who are not relieved,
and he will be at peace and will be in control.
He will liberate those who are not liberated,
and he will be extinguished and will extinguish others.”
Having thought this,🔽I took a timira flower🔽and sprinkled it on the head
of the Great Seer Siddhattha.

analyzed: gahetvā timirapuppha  matthake okirim aha  añjalim paggahetvāna
translated: I raised my joined palms,
and after circumambulating him,
I bowed to the Teacher’s feet
and left for another direction.
As soon as I had gone a little way,
the king of beasts attacked me.
Following after me,
I fell right there.
For ninety-four eons,
I offered that flower.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping with a flower.
For forty-five eons,
they were very famous,
endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great power.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations as well,
the six supernormal knowledges were realized;
the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus has it been heard by the Elder Timirapucchi.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā timirapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Timirapupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā timirapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽timirapupphiya therassa apadānam paṭhama
translated: The first chapter on the Elders is finished.
